%matplotlib inline

source.23563542:
## Method for creating wordclouds

def display_cloud(data,title,image_colors):
    wc = WordCloud(background_color='white', max_words=500, max_font_size=256,random_state=42,width=Mask.shape[1],height=Mask.shape[0],
                   mask=Mask,color_func=image_colors)
    wc.generate(' '.join(data))
    sns.set_context("talk", font_scale=.9)
    plt.figure(figsize=(20,8))
    plt.imshow(wc,interpolation="bilinear")
    plt.title(title)
    plt.axis('off')
    plt.show()

source.1819c31f:
In this notebook, I am doing exploraroty data analysis on data set 'Indian Food 101'. The data set contains the information about famous indian dishes.

First, I am check the data set for NA/nan/-1 values and replace them with relevant information sourced from wikipedia [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indian_cuisine]

Secondly, I'd plot some graphs to know 
- the trends of food in different region
- correlation between cooking time and food item

Finally,
Let's inference the key take aways from the analysis.


As always I hope you like the kernel, **YOUR UPVOTES ARE HIGHLY APPRECIATED**.

![Indian Cuisine Map](https://www.humanium.org/fr/wp-content/uploads/repas-inde.jpeg)


[Click Here to Visit Source of Map](https://www.humanium.org/en/indian-food-diversity/)

Inference: 
- Cooking time almost same across flavors except Sweet & Spicy
- Sweets and Spicy Food usually takes more time to prepare and cook than that of others
- It takes 60-240 minutes to prepare & cook any given Indian Food except few Sweets and Spicy delicacies
- Preparation time for starter is usually longer than that of others

- Top 5 Famous Vegetarian food is from Gujarat, Maharashtra, Punjab, Tamil Nadu and Andhra Pradesh 
- Top 5 Famous Non Vegetarian food is from Assam, Maharashtra, West Bengal, Punjab and Telangana
- People residing in North East and East are fond of Non-vegetarian food compared to that of others

**The Following are the Speciality Foods  from different States:**

- Misti doi - West Bengal

- Obbattu holige - Karnataka

- Chak Hao Kheer - Manipur
- Chicken Tikka - Punjab
- Pindi chana - Punjab
- Tandoori Chicken - Punjab
- Tandoori Fish Tikka - Punjab
- Attu - Andhra Pradesh

- Puttu - Kerala
